page.title: 11HOBBIES, HOUSING, EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Being a rural community many of the residents spend much of their free time gardening.There are no clubs in the village to which they can belong. Other than additional footpaths the residents are more than happy with the village as it is. The younger children of the community would like a play ground area as there is no where for them to play. Housing wiyhin the village is either concil or belongs to the estate. Very few houses are privately owned. It is felt that if ground was released by the Earl of Yarborough for private development the size of the village would increase dramatically. Many of the men folk are employed on the estate. Others are employed in various occupations either in Grimsby,Brigg, or Immingham.
